story:
a Map of uncharted territory

Can something as simple as a bar of chocolate turn a head, spin a tune, conjure a time + place long forgotten, recall a day of sun and sand on the darkest of winter evenings? Make us stand up, fall over, laugh out loud, or our heart skip a beat? Get us to dive deeper, twirl a hand through a wisp of a dream? Can a teensy bite turn a whole life of wondering what? into a single thought of this.

Heck yeah, it can.

how small you begin has nothing to do with how far you will go.

Map began with a $50 purchase of beans and a tiny borrowed grinder. It was scary, exciting, mind-blowing: making chocolate. As in making chocolate, not melting pre-made blocks or chips, but taking handfuls of cocoa beans, roasting them, winnowing the shell away, then putting the nibs into the grinder where suddenly the flavor inside began to say chocolate. I made my first batch, a brave soul took a bite of the chocolate and said more please. And that's when I knew.

The doing of it and the idea of being a chocolate maker made me immeasurably happy. Ok, I did (and still do) a few skips and sometimes still shriek when the whole workshop smells like baking brownie (amazing), but happy is a short path. It needs to go somewhere, and is not something to sit on or keep tucked somewhere safe and warm: it need to fluff its lil feathers and fly, head out into the world. Kick up a ruckus, maybe stir a few emotions, and on a good day, open some eyes. Happy felt good, but seeing somebody else happy with a Map in their hands was incredible. 

why we chocolate.

Chocolate is not just a flavor to crave, but a food group. A stand-in for the day when your best friend is MIA, a breakfast food, a bartering tool when words are not enough, a currency of kindness, a fine and lovely thread wrapping round the world. It is all these things and the Map is just our way of saying go see for yourself.  

er, actually it's Mackenzie and People.

The cacao beans I use in making chocolate pass through many hands: the hands of farmers who planted and tended the trees, harvested the cacao pods and split them open, the folks who fermented and dried the beans and used their wisdom, experience, and know-how to bring those beans one step closer to what we even think of as chocolate. There are hardworking people who earn their livelihood tending cacao and sending it to makers like me so we can make chocolate and send it back into the world.

A cacao bean in its raw state is a far cry from what we have come to think of as chocolate. And this is part of the magic and beauty, and of course, the journey from bean to bar: every bean has a story to tell, and the language it speaks is chocolate. We just have to be willing to let it speak, and do our part to listen, and taste. And pass it along. 

chocolate is our jam

As a solopreneur I source + sample the different cacao origins, then test + design the chocolate bar formulations (math after high school! who knew). I do every step of the bean to bar process, from roasting to winnowing, to grinding, overseeing the conching, tasting (#dreamjob), to tempering by hand (#oldschool) and pouring the silken chocolate into the bar moulds. I built + maintain the Map website, design and make the wrappers for the bars and all the labels for the range of Map Chocolate products (the Map cold brew featured by Bloomberg Business Review, hot drinking chocolates, a line of chocolate granola, craft chocolate pantry goods, and tasting kits). I'm the email-answerer, bill payer, stockist invoicer, floor sweeper and dish washer, and Map's social media writer and communicator. I'm proud that after two years of crafting chocolate (happy 3rd year anniversary March 14, Map!) my work has been featured in blog posts , reviews, magazine articles, I've been asked to write for a major dessert trade publication, interviewed in podcasts, and handed some blush-worthy kudos for Map's bars. 

It's in the Map DNA: our belief that the most over-rated travel itinerary goes straight from Point A to Point B.

Map has been built as a self-funding business: kind folks buy our chocolate, revenue comes in, and we've used that to purchase equipment piece by piece, materials for the wrappers, and beans. Lots and lots of beans. Our first step toward helping Map grow its reach was to move into a new workshop in 2016, so as our sales increased (thank you, truly) that has been used for the fixtures, plumbing, rent, etc. 

We do chocolate old school, and that is better than okay. We're building not just a business, crafting not just a livelihood, but building a Map for doing life well on a small scale, one happy bite at a time.

This means a mindful process of growth hand-in-hand with scaling. 

#notafactory

Craft chocolate is, at the soul of it, a bunch of steps in the direction away from the industrialized automated approach to making chocolate. Bean to the bar is simply a process that can be used by factory small/large or micro-batch home chocolate maker alike. 

But craft is about intention: a dedicated focus that begins at the bean, that aims to highlight and explore a cacao origin's unique flavors and personality. It is connection to the bean, first and foremost. Cocoa beans are wonderfully diverse and reflect the region in which they're grown, and the care they've been shown. A craft chocolate maker seeks to create an authentic chocolate unmasked by fillers, flavorings, and over-processing. And when chocolate is small batch crafted like Map, each bar batch stands out as a singular tree in what would otherwise be a forest of homogenized, overly-sweetened sad sameness. 

time for a better tool. also, the lowdown

Sam Ratto of Videri Chocolate, a highly respected longtime chocolate maker and one of the pioneers of craft chocolate has designed and created the first small-batch grinder made by a chocolate maker, test-driven by a chocolate maker, for chocolate makers. This is revolutionary and high-five worthy because until he did, most makers begin with small wet grinders that are designed for grinding spices. The small grinders work well enough, but also, are consistently inconsistent and unreliable (and did I mention they catch on fire?) Simply, they are being asked to do a job they weren't designed to do (cardamom is not cacao). The reason chocolate makers use the grinders is because before craft chocolate came to be chocolate was made in big factories, using industrial processes, and industrial-scaled equipment. In other words, we've had no choice. So we make chocolate and buy the next size up spice grinder, and sometimes this works, for awhile. But Sam said it best:

"There’s nothing like chocolate. We love its smell, its texture, its variety and versatility. But it’s not enough to just love chocolate. We also have to respect it. We go to preposterous lengths finding and refining the best cocoa beans. What does it say about our love if we toss our hard-won prize into the cruel mouth of an ill-designed grinder? Rottar is the small-batch grinder chocolate deserves. It was designed for chocolate makers, by chocolate makers, to help those extraordinary little beans achieve their full, delicious potential."

Dear Sam, did we mention we love you?

the idea of an authentic tool, well-designed, intended for small-batch bean to bar is like music to our chocolate making and lovin' ears.

And we need one. In order to stay small and keep the craft in Map Chocolate,  it is time for a bigger grinder. One that is designed well, made well, and aligns with why we make chocolate in the first place. The Rottar small-batch chocolate grinder is:

Designed, tested, and used by a chocolate maker, for chocolate makers.

Built in America. 

Has a 100 kilogram drum capacity. Map currently runs 5 (yes, 5!) very small 8-pound grinders at a time, 24/7 and then some, though due to the consistent unreliability it is rare all are up and running simultaneously #bummer #apologiesforthewait The time in loading, cleaning, repairing these *&##@! charming little melangeurs can be better focused on one well-designed reliable grinder. One grinder to load, to empty, to clean. 

The Rottar has granite wheels sourced in North Carolina (read: of known origin, manufacture, sustainability), a direct drive motor, stainless steel drum. 

The icing on the chocolate-making cake: It will be built for Map and custom-installed in the Map workshop by the Ratto brothers. 

 

and...the toast that goes hand in hand with that jam we mentioned earlier.

our Indiegogo campaign is for the $25,000 needed to buy the Rottar grinder. 

Our campaign is All Or Nothing: we raise enough or we can't buy the grinder. I could have ticked the box for Flexible Funding, which would mean Map could keep whatever amount was raised but. BUT. This is what Map needs. 

And here is where I'm supposed to tell you why the world needs Map Chocolate. 

It is what I ask myself everyday. What I wonder while roasting the beans, what I think about when I sit down to calculate how many pounds of beans I need to buy and see a road in the distance with a shimmering mirage that seems to say how...it's what I ask when I peruse a wall of fine and lovely chocolate bars and see a Map on the self right beside some of my chocolate-making heroes, and what I question at 4 am when I begin tempering the first batch of what will be a beautiful day.

And I say yes. A whopping big yes to the need for small makers like me who bring our handful of joy into the world, and sometimes with a little note inside because we want to do it that way. Yes to small as a business model, because if Map can do it then somebody else can see and believe in and pursue their dream too. And yes to Map because it's not just about me: Map is Mackenzie, but from there the journey goes to And People. I'm here because it's the people part where the beauty of the story begins to unfurl. I make the chocolate, folks (hello there and thank you) buy it and eat it and share it and stash it, and many times, tell me they love it. All the while a cacao tree is rising toward the sun, a bird flits beyond the leaves, a hand reaches toward a ripened pod, beans are loaded and hauled and shipped, and land at the Map workshop and I take a look and say hello there. Finally, after such a long journey one day someone takes a bite. And from there the story unfolds, all the way around the world, 20 degrees North or South of the equator this story grows, encircling this sweetly spinning planet with the most beautiful of storytelling foods.

So yes. Yes to more love, more chocolate, and building the Map.

what it will mean to Map

We will be able to keep making the chocolate we make, pouring in every ounce of our not-like-anybody-else's inspiration we put into each and every bar. Without the grinder Map is not sustainable. End of story.

thank you for finding the Map

Thank you for telling your friend-family-Instagram peoples-neighbors-fellow chocolate lovers about the Map campaign. It has been so fun putting together the perks (a chocolate weekend retreat! slow chocolate zippered pouches with Map bars!) We hope you love what we're offering as much as we love the idea of crafting them for you. Here are a few peeks of what will help Map when you back us through a perk, and what will make your mailbox very happy:

slow down + enjoy the chocolate zippered pouch w/ two Map bars

#podgrl tote bag

In Pod We Trust tee-shirt, white or gray

high five set of 5 Map bars

 

 

And always, always!  if you have questions we're at mapchocolate@gmail.com

how small you begin has nothing to do with how far you will go.

Map began with a $50 purchase of beans and a tiny borrowed grinder. It was scary, exciting, mind-blowing: making chocolate. As in making chocolate, not melting pre-made blocks or chips, but taking handfuls of cocoa beans, roasting them, winnowing the shell away, then putting the nibs into the grinder where suddenly the flavor inside began to say chocolate. I made my first batch, a brave soul took a bite of the chocolate and said more please. And that's when I knew.
The doing of it and the idea of being a chocolate maker made me immeasurably happy. Ok, I did (and still do) a few skips and sometimes still shriek when the whole workshop smells like baking brownie (amazing), but happy is a short path. It needs to go somewhere, and is not something to sit on or keep tucked somewhere safe and warm: it need to fluff its lil feathers and fly, head out into the world. Kick up a ruckus, maybe stir a few emotions, and on a good day, open some eyes. Happy felt good, but seeing somebody else happy with a Map in their hands was incredible. 
why we chocolate.
Chocolate is not just a flavor to crave, but a food group. A stand-in for the day when your best friend is MIA, a breakfast food, a bartering tool when words are not enough, a currency of kindness, a fine and lovely thread wrapping round the world. It is all these things and the Map is just our way of saying go see for yourself.  
er, actually it's Mackenzie and People.
The cacao beans I use in making chocolate pass through many hands: the hands of farmers who planted and tended the trees, harvested the cacao pods and split them open, the folks who fermented and dried the beans and used their wisdom, experience, and know-how to bring those beans one step closer to what we even think of as chocolate. There are hardworking people who earn their livelihood tending cacao and sending it to makers like me so we can make chocolate and send it back into the world.
A cacao bean in its raw state is a far cry from what we have come to think of as chocolate. And this is part of the magic and beauty, and of course, the journey from bean to bar: every bean has a story to tell, and the language it speaks is chocolate. We just have to be willing to let it speak, and do our part to listen, and taste. And pass it along. 
chocolate is our jam

As a solopreneur I source + sample the different cacao origins, then test + design the chocolate bar formulations (math after high school! who knew). I do every step of the bean to bar process, from roasting to winnowing, to grinding, overseeing the conching, tasting (#dreamjob), to tempering by hand (#oldschool) and pouring the silken chocolate into the bar moulds. I built + maintain the Map website, design and make the wrappers for the bars and all the labels for the range of Map Chocolate products (the Map cold brew featured by Bloomberg Business Review, hot drinking chocolates, a line of chocolate granola, craft chocolate pantry goods, and tasting kits). I'm the email-answerer, bill payer, stockist invoicer, floor sweeper and dish washer, and Map's social media writer and communicator. I'm proud that after two years of crafting chocolate (happy 3rd year anniversary March 14, Map!) my work has been featured in blog posts , reviews, magazine articles, I've been asked to write for a major dessert trade publication, interviewed in podcasts, and handed some blush-worthy kudos for Map's bars. 
It's in the Map DNA: our belief that the most over-rated travel itinerary goes straight from Point A to Point B.

Map has been built as a self-funding business: kind folks buy our chocolate, revenue comes in, and we've used that to purchase equipment piece by piece, materials for the wrappers, and beans. Lots and lots of beans. Our first step toward helping Map grow its reach was to move into a new workshop in 2016, so as our sales increased (thank you, truly) that has been used for the fixtures, plumbing, rent, etc. 
We do chocolate old school, and that is better than okay. We're building not just a business, crafting not just a livelihood, but building a Map for doing life well on a small scale, one happy bite at a time.
This means a mindful process of growth hand-in-hand with scaling. 
#notafactory
Craft chocolate is, at the soul of it, a bunch of steps in the direction away from the industrialized automated approach to making chocolate. Bean to the bar is simply a process that can be used by factory small/large or micro-batch home chocolate maker alike. 
But craft is about intention: a dedicated focus that begins at the bean, that aims to highlight and explore a cacao origin's unique flavors and personality. It is connection to the bean, first and foremost. Cocoa beans are wonderfully diverse and reflect the region in which they're grown, and the care they've been shown. A craft chocolate maker seeks to create an authentic chocolate unmasked by fillers, flavorings, and over-processing. And when chocolate is small batch crafted like Map, each bar batch stands out as a singular tree in what would otherwise be a forest of homogenized, overly-sweetened sad sameness. 
time for a better tool. also, the lowdown

Sam Ratto of Videri Chocolate, a highly respected longtime chocolate maker and one of the pioneers of craft chocolate has designed and created the first small-batch grinder made by a chocolate maker, test-driven by a chocolate maker, for chocolate makers. This is revolutionary and high-five worthy because until he did, most makers begin with small wet grinders that are designed for grinding spices. The small grinders work well enough, but also, are consistently inconsistent and unreliable (and did I mention they catch on fire?) Simply, they are being asked to do a job they weren't designed to do (cardamom is not cacao). The reason chocolate makers use the grinders is because before craft chocolate came to be chocolate was made in big factories, using industrial processes, and industrial-scaled equipment. In other words, we've had no choice. So we make chocolate and buy the next size up spice grinder, and sometimes this works, for awhile. But Sam said it best:
"There’s nothing like chocolate. We love its smell, its texture, its variety and versatility. But it’s not enough to just love chocolate. We also have to respect it. We go to preposterous lengths finding and refining the best cocoa beans. What does it say about our love if we toss our hard-won prize into the cruel mouth of an ill-designed grinder? Rottar is the small-batch grinder chocolate deserves. It was designed for chocolate makers, by chocolate makers, to help those extraordinary little beans achieve their full, delicious potential."
Dear Sam, did we mention we love you?
the idea of an authentic tool, well-designed, intended for small-batch bean to bar is like music to our chocolate making and lovin' ears.
And we need one. In order to stay small and keep the craft in Map Chocolate,  it is time for a bigger grinder. One that is designed well, made well, and aligns with why we make chocolate in the first place. The Rottar small-batch chocolate grinder is:
Designed, tested, and used by a chocolate maker, for chocolate makers.
Built in America. 
Has a 100 kilogram drum capacity. Map currently runs 5 (yes, 5!) very small 8-pound grinders at a time, 24/7 and then some, though due to the consistent unreliability it is rare all are up and running simultaneously #bummer #apologiesforthewait The time in loading, cleaning, repairing these *&##@! charming little melangeurs can be better focused on one well-designed reliable grinder. One grinder to load, to empty, to clean. 
The Rottar has granite wheels sourced in North Carolina (read: of known origin, manufacture, sustainability), a direct drive motor, stainless steel drum. 
The icing on the chocolate-making cake: It will be built for Map and custom-installed in the Map workshop by the Ratto brothers. 



 
and...the toast that goes hand in hand with that jam we mentioned earlier.
our Indiegogo campaign is for the $25,000 needed to buy the Rottar grinder. 
Our campaign is All Or Nothing: we raise enough or we can't buy the grinder. I could have ticked the box for Flexible Funding, which would mean Map could keep whatever amount was raised but. BUT. This is what Map needs. 
And here is where I'm supposed to tell you why the world needs Map Chocolate. 
It is what I ask myself everyday. What I wonder while roasting the beans, what I think about when I sit down to calculate how many pounds of beans I need to buy and see a road in the distance with a shimmering mirage that seems to say how...it's what I ask when I peruse a wall of fine and lovely chocolate bars and see a Map on the self right beside some of my chocolate-making heroes, and what I question at 4 am when I begin tempering the first batch of what will be a beautiful day.
And I say yes. A whopping big yes to the need for small makers like me who bring our handful of joy into the world, and sometimes with a little note inside because we want to do it that way. Yes to small as a business model, because if Map can do it then somebody else can see and believe in and pursue their dream too. And yes to Map because it's not just about me: Map is Mackenzie, but from there the journey goes to And People. I'm here because it's the people part where the beauty of the story begins to unfurl. I make the chocolate, folks (hello there and thank you) buy it and eat it and share it and stash it, and many times, tell me they love it. All the while a cacao tree is rising toward the sun, a bird flits beyond the leaves, a hand reaches toward a ripened pod, beans are loaded and hauled and shipped, and land at the Map workshop and I take a look and say hello there. Finally, after such a long journey one day someone takes a bite. And from there the story unfolds, all the way around the world, 20 degrees North or South of the equator this story grows, encircling this sweetly spinning planet with the most beautiful of storytelling foods.
So yes. Yes to more love, more chocolate, and building the Map.
what it will mean to Map
We will be able to keep making the chocolate we make, pouring in every ounce of our not-like-anybody-else's inspiration we put into each and every bar. Without the grinder Map is not sustainable. End of story.
thank you for finding the Map

Thank you for telling your friend-family-Instagram peoples-neighbors-fellow chocolate lovers about the Map campaign. It has been so fun putting together the perks (a chocolate weekend retreat! slow chocolate zippered pouches with Map bars!) We hope you love what we're offering as much as we love the idea of crafting them for you. Here are a few peeks of what will help Map when you back us through a perk, and what will make your mailbox very happy:
slow down + enjoy the chocolate zippered pouch w/ two Map bars

#podgrl tote bag

In Pod We Trust tee-shirt, white or gray

high five set of 5 Map bars

 
 
And always, always!  if you have questions we're at mapchocolate@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi guys we are Cristiano and Andrea. 
We are the founders of PickyWops.

PickyWops is an ethical Modern Italian Pizzeria, 100% Vegan which offer a selection of 7 alternative options to the most processed flours.

Our bases are wholemeal and type2 flours only (top quality), with 2 ancient grains and we are the only pizzeria in the country offering a Plantain Fruitarian Pizza.

Check the link below on the MedicalDaily facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/MedicalDaily/videos/247619785906039/

Check also Tasty Vegetarian:

https://www.facebook.com/tastyvegetarian/videos...

We open our first shop in September 2016 as an omni Pizzeria, offering also meat and dairy until, I (Cristiano) became Vegan in January 2017, thanks to Veganuary. Andrea turned Vegan in March the same year.

When both of us made the jump we decided in 2 weeks to ditch all the animal products out of our shop FOREVER. On 2nd of April 2017, PickyWops took a leap and was reborn as a fully vegan business. We are as proud to have made that decision as we were on that day.

It was the best decision we ever made! 

Our vegan pizza won the second place to an omni Pizza competition in 2016. From all the Italian Pizza Chefs that entered, we were the only ones with Vegan Pizzas! So proud! 

We also successfully attended Eat Drink Vegan which is one of the largest Vegan Festivals in USA, from which we met so many beautiful people from the industry who we consider our family in Los Angeles.

We have been also listed as the best Vegan Pizza in the World on Happy Cow updated Feb 2018!

We collaborated also with influencers from all over the World in the video above with EpiVegan.

In December 2017 we open our second shop in a project which was advertised as community focused and inclined to help young independent businesses. 

Unfortunately it revealed to be completely different to what was advertised. In addition to misleading promises we had to deal with very abusive working conditions, health issues and received no support from the corporate running the project. 

https://youtu.be/ws9wSo8oorY

In August this year, in order to open a bigger shop, our shareholder suggested we close the doors to our first lovely shop in Fulham. While dealing with a new location near by, 

Unfortunately our investor pulled out of the relocation, due to the extremely high running cost of our second shop. We now are without a place to be at the end of this month. 

This is the reason why we need your help.. We cannot give up and this is our chance to get better and stronger and we cannot do it without you!!

So we put together a bunch of nice, fun Perks in exchange of your support from a simple Thanks to a Lifetime Pizza Card!!

If you believe in us please share and support us!!

Peace

What We Need & What You Get

more detail:

We would need £60000 to be able to help us and cover all the opening costs of the restaurant.

We appreciate any contribution and you can get in exchange lots of nice and fun perks like Pizza, Merchandising, Classes, Parties and more to come.

If we shouldn't reach entire goal we are going to set up whatever we can with the funds reached.

 

POETRY

What makes PickyWops different is the variety of pizza dough we offer, which are all unique in flavor, color and texture. 

The PickyWops concept is also about welcoming all the communities, regardless of their background, opinion or colors.

PickyWops aims to bring everyone together and immerse itself in the community.

Just like the Wops.

Yes exactly like our ancestors who migrated in search of a dream.

 

MEANING

Picky = fussy and hard to please...
(you can actually pick your base)

Wops = offensive & racist word used to define
Italians in 1900. origin uncertain,
perhaps from Italian GUAPPO ‘bold, showy’
(Cristiano and Andrea are 2 Italian immigrants!)


Because we are the first and the only ones in town to use many different alternative flours.

Because we are against any type of discrimination.

Because we look at contents not labels,

we are proud to take our Ancestors Heritage and change the Wops connotation into something positive.

The Impact

Your contribution is going to support the only Fruitarian Plantain Pizza (Gluten Free) in the UK and the possible expansion (National and International).

also the only one in London offering a selection of 6 Top Quality flours with 2 ancient grains.

Your contribution will keep alive an Ethical business in a World where Ethics are seen as a weakness.

Risks & Challenges

This is a very difficult journey full of obstacles and challenges but we are trained to take it in the best way. In the past 2 years we have been going through so many adversity which we always handle with the most transparency, respect and ethics.

Facing the problems with positive mind so far it's been the key for us to get better outcomes every single time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute with money no worries stay blessed and spread Love..if you can tell your friends.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Goal is to expand our capabilities and capacity for roasting and developing new types of coffee such as wood smoking coffee.

We're developing a unique, high–volume beverage shop with coffee, espresso, teas, chocolate, fruit, vegetable and grain beverages.

I will utilize my years of experience in fast casual style  beverage operation, and also add food and snack items to enhance the experience and increase revenue and profits.

We will use my proprietary method for teaching other entrepreneurs how to duplicate our success called un-franchising that I developed some 30 years ago.

This is important to me as small businesses are the top job creation engine for the US economy and entrepreneurs have no model to follow other than franchising. We can give them one for a one-time fee that is less than the savings we can provide them.

The capital will help us fund the new equipment for roasting, beverage, and food equipment

This original store will fulfill the dream of helping others and develop the UNfranchising model.

Our request for $30,000 will help fund the new store.

If we don’t reach our goal of $30,000, we will use whatever our funding is and still move forward.  It will just take longer.

I was in the food and beverage industry for 50 years prior to retirement. Being instrumental in building 26 restaurants, new concepts, coffee and beverage shops, I invented true fast casual service in the 1970and have done this model many times.  No challenge just doing it again.

I came out of retirement 3 years ago to do this endeavor out of a sincere desire to share my knowledge, experience and skills with others before a final retirement.

*********All Contributors will get names on an in store plaque********

*********Contributors will have priority in the selection as "unfranchisees"

story:
Raphael's Donuts (Who we are):

Raphael's Donuts is a 100% vegan & low glycemic (diabetic-friendly), allergy-friendly donut online home delivery and mail order company that is on a mission to change people's lifestyles and the donut industry as a whole with delicious baked donuts that don't cause harm to animals, humans' overall health, or even the environment. Raphael's Donuts is the world's only online donut company in history in its own kind baked in gluten free (chickpea) and whole wheat flour versions in 11 year-round flavors. We use organic agave nectar, xylitol, herbal teas, fruit juices, chia, hemp, and flax seeds in our donuts. No gmos, peanuts, tree nuts, coconuts, yeast, soy or animal ingredients of all kinds are ever used in them, since we became 100% vegan in June 2017. 

From our inspiration of birth to now! 

Raphael's Donuts was launched in May 2014 as a lacto-ovo-vegetarian low glycemic (diabetic-friendly) donut company out of inspiration from owner/masterbaker Raphael Harlan's deceased adoptive mother Cora Lee Harlan's 2011 death of kidney disease as she was an omnivorous diabetic who loved baked desserts but couldn't have donuts because no company or person was making low glycemic donuts in her 75 year lifetime before it was never done before. By him being a long time healthnut, self-taught unique gourmet baker, and an experienced entrepreneur, the Raphael's Donuts concept came in a dream in Fall 2013 and after testing out my imaginatively unique donut recipes and having former UM-Flint professors and classmates test-tasting them, Raphael's Donuts was born with him putting $600 of his own money into it. 

(Raphael's adoptive mom, Cora Lee Harlan)

Raphael (pre-vegan in 2009 in Detroit in his adoptive home)

(Raphael as a vegan, seen on Fox 2 News representing Raphael's Donuts)

Even though we started slow in the first 17 months as a non-vegan low glycemic donut company doing mostly Genesee County farmers markets and vendor events with two occasions having our donuts carried in a Flint, Michigan-based health food store, averaging six dozen sold a month due to our clientele being limited, our donuts were loved, enjoyed, and appreciated by most of our customers back then and because of that -- along with us winning our only business grant competition of $1500 from the rotary club, we made changes in the business model in late 2015 which involved us downsizing our production scale back to our home kitchen production, creating a new base recipe, and switching to online sales with the yearround home delivery service launching in November 2015. The adjustments resulted in more than half of our flavors being veganized (which got us more vegan customers than non-vegan customers) and more as our monthly sales grew and our annual revenue grew, and they also led us not only into Raphael himself going full vegan in September 2016 but also Raphael's Donuts as a rebounding and growing company going 100% vegan in June 2017 with our donuts also being free of tree nuts, soy, yeast, peanuts, coconuts, or GMOs as it's been the case since November 2015. Those changes and adjustments have resulted in three consecutive years with high annual revenues, growth in employee base as we currently have five employees and a business, sales, and customer service manager and partner, bigger sales average, us being featured in many publications (such as Fox 2 Detroit, Flint Journal, and others) and us expanding to nationwide mail order earlier this year. We also have many five star reviews and positive testimonials as well as over 4,300 likes on our Facebook page, showing that more customers widespread are in love with our donuts and us!

We currently do Mid and Southeastern Michigan home delivery and nationwide mail order yearround selling half dozen and dozen packs & sample packs on our website, along with vendor events selling doubles (2packs) and triples (3packs) seasonally, mostly during the summer months. We also sell fundraising orders to non profit organizations and businesses  Recently we have a Dexter, MI-based cider mill selling our gluten free vegan donuts and because of it, we were able to maximize our current monthly baking capacity that the cottage law allows us to do because they were selling out almost every week. Now we are in a dire need to expand and scale back up to a rental commercial kitchen setting so we can continue to not only fulfill more cider mill orders but more future wholesale orders from potential retailers and restaurants, alongside our e-commerce yearround channels and seasonal vendor events. Our long term vision as a pioneering vegan donut company of its kind is to not only bring Americans and the rest of the world uniquely healthy and tasty vegan donuts as part of their lives in the best ways -- through mail orders and through retailers of all size ---  but also change their lives through other non-donut baked desserts as we see ourselves doing many  healthy vegan donut product lines as well as non-donut baked desserts. With your contributions, we will be one step closer to doing so! 

  

 

High Moments during our 4 year history: 

  • 112 11/12 dozen Raphael's Donuts sold in September 2018 (most in a single month in RD history w/ all sales channels  --- 88 dozen of them to Dexter Cider Mill in 3 orders, rest through home delivery and mail orders -- 9 orders combined -- and 2 vendor event appearances in September: Downtown Owosso Farmers Market & Holt Farmers Market)
  • 42 3/4 dozen Raphael's Donuts sold in May 2017 (most in a single month in RD history with just home delivery orders and vendor events; the month before we became 100% vegan)
  • 30 1/4 dozen Raphael's Donuts sold in June 2017 (most in a single month in RD history with just online and vendor events since we became 100% vegan; also best month in RD history for vendor events with 24 3/4 dozen sold.)
  •  Most orders in a single month: September 2018 with 12 orders
  • Most orders in a single year: 2018 with 85 orders and counting

What we need with your contributions!

In order for us to expand back into a commercial kitchen, we definitely need to raise at least $9000 to offset costs for at least 3 months' rent and renewal of our wholesale MDA license, upgrades of our website (two years worth with our own domain with Wix), labeling, marketing materials, new bakeware for current donut line, soon-to-be donut ballz as sample packs, and up and coming non-donut baked dessert product line (brownies' debut date estimated between November and early January) and purchases of our Raphael's Donuts ingredients in bulk, as well as reliable tablets or Chromebook computers with monthly internet service and liability food insurance ($300/year). In exchange for your contributions and support, we're offering awesome perks to include you in our growing, revolutionary ride of success! (We even have perks for vegan businesses and any company in America that offers vegan options)! Any extra contributions will be used towards our social media marketing, offline marketing, pay for our current employees and perhaps adding baking interns to our team and us booking bigger future vendor events in Michigan and outside Michigan, plus if we reach past the halfway point of our goal ($4500) we will donate $4 for every $50 raised (past the halfway point) to a foster care agency of our choice, in courtesy of us being an adoptive child-owned company (Raphael was adopted in 2001).  If we reach 75% of our goal ($6750), we will throw a meetup party at one of the future retailers that choose to carry our donut products! If we reach our full goal ($9000) or exceed it, we will also donate 5% of our future monthly wholesale sales to an animal sanctuary of our choosing. 

Of course you can choose not to receive any perks if you don't want any perks. With your support, we can continue to make our healthier, allergy-friendly vegan donuts more accessible, exciting, and affordable plus change more people's lives. 

Can't afford to contribute? There are other ways to support us!

If you can't afford to contribute to our Indiegogo campaign, don't worry! You can still support us by sharing our campaign on your social media networks, including Facebook using Indiegogo share tools! We appreciate your support in any way you can --- monetarily or out of the kindness of your heart! Feel free to share our campaign with your favorite coffee shops, cider mills, health food stores, schools, churches, non profit organizations, news stations, newspaper and magazine publications, radio stations, whoever you wish to tell about Raphael's Donuts! We greatly appreciate! If you have questions about our campaign or how Indiegogo works, you can see the FAQ section of this campaign. If you have questions regarding Raphael's Donuts, you can also check out our website at raphaelharlan.wixsite.com/raphaelsdonuts where you can still order your Raphael's Donuts.
story_txt:
Raphael's Donuts (Who we are):
Raphael's Donuts is a 100% vegan & low glycemic (diabetic-friendly), allergy-friendly donut online home delivery and mail order company that is on a mission to change people's lifestyles and the donut industry as a whole with delicious baked donuts that don't cause harm to animals, humans' overall health, or even the environment. Raphael's Donuts is the world's only online donut company in history in its own kind baked in gluten free (chickpea) and whole wheat flour versions in 11 year-round flavors. We use organic agave nectar, xylitol, herbal teas, fruit juices, chia, hemp, and flax seeds in our donuts. No gmos, peanuts, tree nuts, coconuts, yeast, soy or animal ingredients of all kinds are ever used in them, since we became 100% vegan in June 2017. 
From our inspiration of birth to now! 
Raphael's Donuts was launched in May 2014 as a lacto-ovo-vegetarian low glycemic (diabetic-friendly) donut company out of inspiration from owner/masterbaker Raphael Harlan's deceased adoptive mother Cora Lee Harlan's 2011 death of kidney disease as she was an omnivorous diabetic who loved baked desserts but couldn't have donuts because no company or person was making low glycemic donuts in her 75 year lifetime before it was never done before. By him being a long time healthnut, self-taught unique gourmet baker, and an experienced entrepreneur, the Raphael's Donuts concept came in a dream in Fall 2013 and after testing out my imaginatively unique donut recipes and having former UM-Flint professors and classmates test-tasting them, Raphael's Donuts was born with him putting $600 of his own money into it. 

(Raphael's adoptive mom, Cora Lee Harlan)

Raphael (pre-vegan in 2009 in Detroit in his adoptive home)

(Raphael as a vegan, seen on Fox 2 News representing Raphael's Donuts)
Even though we started slow in the first 17 months as a non-vegan low glycemic donut company doing mostly Genesee County farmers markets and vendor events with two occasions having our donuts carried in a Flint, Michigan-based health food store, averaging six dozen sold a month due to our clientele being limited, our donuts were loved, enjoyed, and appreciated by most of our customers back then and because of that -- along with us winning our only business grant competition of $1500 from the rotary club, we made changes in the business model in late 2015 which involved us downsizing our production scale back to our home kitchen production, creating a new base recipe, and switching to online sales with the yearround home delivery service launching in November 2015. The adjustments resulted in more than half of our flavors being veganized (which got us more vegan customers than non-vegan customers) and more as our monthly sales grew and our annual revenue grew, and they also led us not only into Raphael himself going full vegan in September 2016 but also Raphael's Donuts as a rebounding and growing company going 100% vegan in June 2017 with our donuts also being free of tree nuts, soy, yeast, peanuts, coconuts, or GMOs as it's been the case since November 2015. Those changes and adjustments have resulted in three consecutive years with high annual revenues, growth in employee base as we currently have five employees and a business, sales, and customer service manager and partner, bigger sales average, us being featured in many publications (such as Fox 2 Detroit, Flint Journal, and others) and us expanding to nationwide mail order earlier this year. We also have many five star reviews and positive testimonials as well as over 4,300 likes on our Facebook page, showing that more customers widespread are in love with our donuts and us!
We currently do Mid and Southeastern Michigan home delivery and nationwide mail order yearround selling half dozen and dozen packs & sample packs on our website, along with vendor events selling doubles (2packs) and triples (3packs) seasonally, mostly during the summer months. We also sell fundraising orders to non profit organizations and businesses  Recently we have a Dexter, MI-based cider mill selling our gluten free vegan donuts and because of it, we were able to maximize our current monthly baking capacity that the cottage law allows us to do because they were selling out almost every week. Now we are in a dire need to expand and scale back up to a rental commercial kitchen setting so we can continue to not only fulfill more cider mill orders but more future wholesale orders from potential retailers and restaurants, alongside our e-commerce yearround channels and seasonal vendor events. Our long term vision as a pioneering vegan donut company of its kind is to not only bring Americans and the rest of the world uniquely healthy and tasty vegan donuts as part of their lives in the best ways -- through mail orders and through retailers of all size ---  but also change their lives through other non-donut baked desserts as we see ourselves doing many  healthy vegan donut product lines as well as non-donut baked desserts. With your contributions, we will be one step closer to doing so! 

  
 
High Moments during our 4 year history: 

112 11/12 dozen Raphael's Donuts sold in September 2018 (most in a single month in RD history w/ all sales channels  --- 88 dozen of them to Dexter Cider Mill in 3 orders, rest through home delivery and mail orders -- 9 orders combined -- and 2 vendor event appearances in September: Downtown Owosso Farmers Market & Holt Farmers Market)
42 3/4 dozen Raphael's Donuts sold in May 2017 (most in a single month in RD history with just home delivery orders and vendor events; the month before we became 100% vegan)
30 1/4 dozen Raphael's Donuts sold in June 2017 (most in a single month in RD history with just online and vendor events since we became 100% vegan; also best month in RD history for vendor events with 24 3/4 dozen sold.)
 Most orders in a single month: September 2018 with 12 orders
Most orders in a single year: 2018 with 85 orders and counting


What we need with your contributions!
In order for us to expand back into a commercial kitchen, we definitely need to raise at least $9000 to offset costs for at least 3 months' rent and renewal of our wholesale MDA license, upgrades of our website (two years worth with our own domain with Wix), labeling, marketing materials, new bakeware for current donut line, soon-to-be donut ballz as sample packs, and up and coming non-donut baked dessert product line (brownies' debut date estimated between November and early January) and purchases of our Raphael's Donuts ingredients in bulk, as well as reliable tablets or Chromebook computers with monthly internet service and liability food insurance ($300/year). In exchange for your contributions and support, we're offering awesome perks to include you in our growing, revolutionary ride of success! (We even have perks for vegan businesses and any company in America that offers vegan options)! Any extra contributions will be used towards our social media marketing, offline marketing, pay for our current employees and perhaps adding baking interns to our team and us booking bigger future vendor events in Michigan and outside Michigan, plus if we reach past the halfway point of our goal ($4500) we will donate $4 for every $50 raised (past the halfway point) to a foster care agency of our choice, in courtesy of us being an adoptive child-owned company (Raphael was adopted in 2001).  If we reach 75% of our goal ($6750), we will throw a meetup party at one of the future retailers that choose to carry our donut products! If we reach our full goal ($9000) or exceed it, we will also donate 5% of our future monthly wholesale sales to an animal sanctuary of our choosing. 
Of course you can choose not to receive any perks if you don't want any perks. With your support, we can continue to make our healthier, allergy-friendly vegan donuts more accessible, exciting, and affordable plus change more people's lives. 

Can't afford to contribute? There are other ways to support us!
If you can't afford to contribute to our Indiegogo campaign, don't worry! You can still support us by sharing our campaign on your social media networks, including Facebook using Indiegogo share tools! We appreciate your support in any way you can --- monetarily or out of the kindness of your heart! Feel free to share our campaign with your favorite coffee shops, cider mills, health food stores, schools, churches, non profit organizations, news stations, newspaper and magazine publications, radio stations, whoever you wish to tell about Raphael's Donuts! We greatly appreciate! If you have questions about our campaign or how Indiegogo works, you can see the FAQ section of this campaign. If you have questions regarding Raphael's Donuts, you can also check out our website at raphaelharlan.wixsite.com/raphaelsdonuts where you can still order your Raphael's Donuts.

story:
Rock Villa®

The most nutritious food ounce for ounce on Earth! And the first ULTRA-Nutritious food in the World, expressed in a design, music & art concept, under a flirty & sexy atmosphere.

Rock Villa® (Bee-yeah) rescues the culinary values of an ancient culture, respecting their indigenous ancestor´s recipes and making them available to a clientele wanting new culinary adventures and healthy, nutritious options.

Our proposal is born out of the clash of twelve cultures of extensive history: Aztec, Mayan, Toltec, Zapotec, Mixtec, Tarascan, Teotihuacan, Huastec, Tlaxcaltec, Totonac and Chichimec.

Our dishes are based on a wide range of native stews and meals from Ancient Mexican culture and traditions, where the ingredients used by their ancestors are incorporated, as well as their indigenous cooking techniques.

Rock Villa® is the first company featuring Ancient Mexican Cuisine in the World under Casual Amazing concept. The food served is healthy and ultra-nutritious thanks to the use of Ancient Mexican cooking techniques, ingredients and recipes.

The quality of the food and the preparation techniques used together protect our health, improve our physical condition, and our brain functions.  It also prevents cardiovascular issues, obesity, cell oxidation and degenerative diseases; among others. 

Not only are we gluten free since we don’t use wheat flour of any kind, we are also dairy free.  We do not use cooking oil of any kind, corn syrup, beet sugar, or cane sugar on any food or beverage we prepare and serve, avoiding unneeded empty calories in all our food.

Tenoch™

Tenoch™ Studio is the first design company in the world dedicated to spreading Ancient Mexican cultures, their history, as well as both ancestral and recent Mexican traditions. Its name comes from the first Aztec Emperor "Tenoch", a name that means in Nahuatl "stone cactus fruit". "Tenoch" the Emperor founded the city of Tenochtitlán, which means "Land of Tenoch".

Tenoch™ Studio developed the concept of Lupe™ and the image and branding of Rock Villa®, but it also has its own identity, which is reflected in art, design, clothing and accessories, among others. Tenoch™ Studio will continue developing new characters, concepts and unique design lines based on the principle of the transforming force of being.

Lupe™

Lupe™ is an Ancient Mexican Skeleton created on Aztec, Mayan and other Ancient Mexican Cultures. The aim of Lupe™ is to show the world from an Ancient Mexican perspective, where death was not seen as a bad event. They saw it as the next step of our existence, as a perpetuation and not the end. 

There is nothing like Lupe™; it is an original and astonishing concept that hasn't previously been used. Because of this, Lupe™ is the first Ancient Mexican character in history.

Lupe™ is the nickname of Guadalupe, a name used by men and women. This charismatic character could become anyone, both past and present - making us laugh, reliving nostalgic moments, and expressing to us present events as well. The light in the ocular cavities is the reflection of his noble loving soul.

 

Investment

In 2017 Alvgar Group, LLC, obtained the exclusive rights of brands and products of Rock Villa®, Tenoch™ and Lupe™ in the United States of America, by United World Companies.

Alvgar Group invested $ 750,000.00 USD in the creation of the first Rock Villa® restaurant in 2017, as well as in Tenoch™ and Lupe™ products for sale in the restaurant.

In May 2018, Alvgar Group signed with Memorial City Mall in the city of Houston, Texas to open the first Rock Villa® restaurant. Alvgar Group has paid 10 months in advance rent to Memorial City Mall.

In June 2018, architects and engineers were contracted for the realization of the restaurant. Blue prints and papers for the construction permit were submitted in October 2018.

We will start the restaurant construction in February 2019 and open in May 2019.

 

Strategy

Our strategy is to build the first Rock Villa® restaurant, where apart from selling the most nutritious foods in the world, we will also carry the products of Tenoch™, Lupe™ and the souvenirs of Rock Villa®. There will be an area in the restaurant for the sale of t-shirts, caps, stickers, mugs, prints, etc.

Thanks to the Rock Villa® restaurant, we will be able to publicize and sell the products and brands of Lupe™ and Tenoch™, without the need to invest in stores for these brands. Boosting each brand with the products of the others.

 

    Current & Future Panorama,

    Overweight and Obesity

    in the USA & the World

    One in three adults (33%), and one in five children (20 %) are obese in America today.

    In 2030, more than 50% of all Americans will be obese (178 million). Approximately 79% of the US population is overweight (174 millions) and in 2030 more than 90% of US population will be overweight (320 millions). In 2030 50% of the world population will be obese (4.2 billion), and 92% will be overweight (7.6 billion).

    Currently there are no real proposals to this problem in existing restaurant chains in the US, nor globally.

    Rock Villa® is the first real and sustainable proposal to these problems, offering a healthy, ultra-nutritious and above all, tasty product! The last feature is the key for the consumption of Rock Villa’s food by the obese and overweight audience. We have an advantage over salad and vegetables meals because they don’t satiate the appetite or palate. Rock Villa® provides texture, flavor and satiety, making it very appealing compared to salads or vegan dishes.

    The aroma, texture, color and taste of Rock Villa’s food is one of a kind.  Foodies will fall in love and become devotees, because it is food for refined & connoisseur palates. Children who are picky eaters will also like Rock Villa’s food.

    The basis of Rock Villa´s menu is the diet used by Ancient Mexican peoples with over 10,000 years of history.  A diet created with the wisdom acquired through thousands of years by native ancestors, where the balance and harmony of the ingredients was given by nature.

     Source: WHO (World Health Organization), HHS (United States Department of Health and Human Services), USA Today.

     

    Undernourishment in the U.S.

    According to research gathered by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), 92% of Americans suffer from at least one mineral or vitamin deficiency. In other words, the entire nation is undernourished, despite being significantly overfed.

    Every 9 of 10 Americans are deficient in potassium, 7 out 10 are deficient in calcium, 8 out of 10 are deficient in vitamin E, 50% of Americans are deficient in vitamin A, vitamin C and magnesium, among others.

     Source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA).

    Our Product

    Rock Villa’s food is the Most Nutritious on the Planet, there’s nothing like it! It contains vitamins, minerals, amino acids, fatty acids, antioxidants, proteins and fiber, among others. The amount of nutrients per ounce is unprecedented; no food in the world is as nutrient dense.

    Our food helps the body to recover from undernourishment in a natural, fast, safe and, above all, delicious way.

    Some of the Properties

    in Rock Villa’s Food:

    • Promotes Weight Loss
    • Low Calorie
    • Low Carb
    • Low Sugar
    • Low Sodium
    • Low Fat
    • No Trans Fats
    • Gluten Free
    • Wheat Free
    • Soy Free
    • Rice Free
    • Dairy Free
    • Egg Free
    • High Protein (Plant & Animal)
    • 100% Vegan Options
    • High in Fiber
    • High in Vitamins
    • High in Minerals
    • High in Amino Acids
    • High in Fatty Acids
    • High in Antioxidants
    • Anti-Aging
    • The First ULTRA-Nutritious Food on Earth!
    • More than 40 Essential Nutrients
    • Health Enhancer
    • Improves Brain Functions
    • Supports Nervous System
    • Supports Immune System
    • Promotes Detoxification
    • Promotes Skin, Hair & Nails Regeneration
    • Food for High Performance Athletes
    • Organic Ingredients
    • High Quality Ingredients
    • Non-GMO
    • Preservative Free
    • All Natural
    • 100% Made from Scratch
    • Hand Crafted Gourmet Food
    • Fully Prepared, Heat & Serve
    • Versatile
    • Microwave Free
    • Vacuum Packed
    • Can Remain Frozen for 1 Year

    Legal Disclaimer: The previous statements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.

     

    Nutrition Facts in Rock Villa’s Meal

    22 oz Serving Size

    Meal Packages

    Every Rock Villa® Meal contains:

    • 2 Sides: 7 oz.
    • 1 Protein: 5 oz.; Chicken, Pork, Beef or Plant. We have 100% Vegan Options!
    • 1 Ultra-Nutritious Sauce: 7 oz.
    • 1 Topping: .5 oz.  
    • 3 Organic Blue Corn Tortillas: 2.5 oz.

    * All foods are vacuum packed, frozen in portions of 10 & can remain frozen for 1 year; Preservative Free!

    10 Rock Villa® ULTRA-Nutritious Meal PK-220 oz:

    • 3 Sides: 70 oz.
    • 4 Proteins: 50 Oz.; Chicken, Pork, Beef & Plant. We have 100% Vegan Options!
    • 4 Ultra-Nutritious Sauces: 70 oz.
    • 5 Toppings: 5 oz.  
    • 30 Organic Blue Corn Tortillas: 25 oz.

    30 Rock Villa® ULTRA-Nutritious Meal PK-660 oz:

    • 3 Sides: 210 oz.
    • 4 Proteins: 150 oz.; Chicken, Pork, Beef & Plant. We have 100% Vegan Options!
    • 4 Ultra-Nutritious Sauces: 210 oz.
    • 5 Toppings: 15 oz.  
    • 90 Organic Blue Corn Tortillas: 75 oz.

    70 Rock Villa® ULTRA-Nutritious Meal PK-1540 oz:

    • 3 Sides: 490 oz.
    • 4 Proteins: 350 oz.; Chicken, Pork, Beef & Plant. We have 100% Vegan Options!
    • 4 Ultra-Nutritious Sauces: 490 oz.
    • 5 Toppings: 35 oz.  
    • 210 Organic Blue Corn Tortillas: 175 oz.

    Note: All meal packages will be delivery in June 2019, see Timeline chart below.

    Allergy Statement!

    The Rock Villa® Meals contain or may have come into contact with:

    • Peanuts

    • Sesame

    • Corn

    • Seeds of all kind

    • Tree Nuts

    • Spices of all kind

    NOTE: If you don't know if you are allergic to any of these food allergens, PLEASE REFRAIN!!!

    Customization

    Customize your package by choosing from the design gallery. Depending on your package you will be choosing digital poster(s), digital wallpapers(s), digital sugar skull(s), digital Christmas card(s), and/or t-shirt(s). Enjoy!

story:
Short Summary

  • This is another project of "Bosanet LLC" www.bosanet.com
  • We strive to offer the less fortunate and the people who can not or choose to not consume regular food and alternative to receive all the nutrients they need for a reasonable price.
  • We have created a product, based on products offered by governments in countries with a high hunger index. This product contains 10 vitamins and 4 minerals.
  • A 200 gram package, with an average price of US$ 3.0/unit, provides 20 meals. I mean, a meal would be priced at 15 cents.
  • For every 3 product sold in the USA, we will give away 1 to a country with a high level of poverty and mal nutrition.
  • We have adapted it to the American market, as a ready to drink product, to turn it into a fundamental product for the times of financial crisis that we will be facing.
  • Nutrition is a fundamental pillar of health. Healthy people are stronger, more productive and want to develop their abilities to the fullest.
  • With your support, we will be supplying the population in the United States with the best nutritional product available to everyone.
  • Our experience has been working in the USA for 16 years, supporting product and service entrepreneurs from Latin America, to introduce products to the North American market.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking for U$350,000 for the development of the project.
  • Currently we have developed the formulas, we have registered the brand "Nutreya!" in several countries of the world, including USA, we have FDA approval, and we already have the real product.
  • We already have the distribution program for the American Market.
  • We already have experience in selling the product in another presentation for other types of markets.
  • With the investment: we will make the first imports for the Florida and New York markets, we will structure the operation in the USA and the marketing strategy for the socialization of the product.
  • Interest: we recognize 15% annually, with interest paid quarterly.
  • Capital: will be paid in 12 months.
  • What happens if we do not reach the goal: We need a minimum of US $ 150,000 to start the operation. If we don't reach $ 350K, we start with less volume of product.

The Impact

  • Currently there is a product in the USA that works for nutritional issues and sick people.
  • Nutreya!, is a better solution for its composition of vitamins and minerals, but with a price to the public, 50% of the closest competitor.
  • With this product, we will be supporting people living in the USA, to maintain a good level of their nutrition at a reasonable price.

Risks & Challenges

Bosanet LLC (www.bosanet.com), the company that operates the Nutreya! Project, has the following experience of 16 years, which minimizes risks:

-Import of products from Latin America

-Coding and marketing of products in retailers

-Coding and marketing of products in wholesalers

-Distribution products in the American Market

-We have a highly trained and experienced team

-We have to be very attentive to the reaction of the market leader, in order to anticipate

Other Ways You Can Help

Nutreya! I will be very grateful for your financial support.

In the event that you cannot do so, we appreciate the support with your contacts, for the well-being of the nutrition of the most needy.

Please share the following link with friends: 

https://igg.me/at/1VxR983ICwI/x/23014451#/
story_txt:
Short Summary

This is another project of "Bosanet LLC" www.bosanet.com

We strive to offer the less fortunate and the people who can not or choose to not consume regular food and alternative to receive all the nutrients they need for a reasonable price.
We have created a product, based on products offered by governments in countries with a high hunger index. This product contains 10 vitamins and 4 minerals.
A 200 gram package, with an average price of US$ 3.0/unit, provides 20 meals. I mean, a meal would be priced at 15 cents.
For every 3 product sold in the USA, we will give away 1 to a country with a high level of poverty and mal nutrition.
We have adapted it to the American market, as a ready to drink product, to turn it into a fundamental product for the times of financial crisis that we will be facing.
Nutrition is a fundamental pillar of health. Healthy people are stronger, more productive and want to develop their abilities to the fullest.
With your support, we will be supplying the population in the United States with the best nutritional product available to everyone.
Our experience has been working in the USA for 16 years, supporting product and service entrepreneurs from Latin America, to introduce products to the North American market.


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for U$350,000 for the development of the project.
Currently we have developed the formulas, we have registered the brand "Nutreya!" in several countries of the world, including USA, we have FDA approval, and we already have the real product.
We already have the distribution program for the American Market.
We already have experience in selling the product in another presentation for other types of markets.
With the investment: we will make the first imports for the Florida and New York markets, we will structure the operation in the USA and the marketing strategy for the socialization of the product.
Interest: we recognize 15% annually, with interest paid quarterly.
Capital: will be paid in 12 months.
What happens if we do not reach the goal: We need a minimum of US $ 150,000 to start the operation. If we don't reach $ 350K, we start with less volume of product.


The Impact

Currently there is a product in the USA that works for nutritional issues and sick people.
Nutreya!, is a better solution for its composition of vitamins and minerals, but with a price to the public, 50% of the closest competitor.
With this product, we will be supporting people living in the USA, to maintain a good level of their nutrition at a reasonable price.


Risks & Challenges

story:
Who are We ?

Old Friends Coffee Bar is a team of two , Stan (me) and my wife Timi. We spent a fair amount of our lives in fine dining industry mostly in upscale establishments.

We were always really passionate about coffee , and are really disappointed to see what coffee industry had became. Luckily the trend is shifting in a positive way and the demand for quality , environmental friendly coffee is growing

So the time seemed right for us to open our own Coffee Bar.

We would like to create a small welcoming environment where there is something for everyone, whenever you would like to read a book or have a conversation , meet some friends or just have a cup of remarkable coffee.We would like to keep things as simple as possible , this way we can focus all our attention to our guests.

 

Our Goals:

  • Local Business support : We use local ingredients this way we can support small independent suppliers.
  • Fresh Coffee : Fresh beans arrive in a roastery 30 minutes away from our Coffee Bar and are roasted daily. 
  • Plastic Free : Buying locally allows us to choose those suppliers which don't use plastic as packaging material but use only Environmental friendly materials instead. 
    Furthermore we have no plastic cups,lids and cutlery,we encourage our customers to use travel mugs instead.
  • Bio and Sustainability: All of our ingredients are coming from sustainable producers with Bio quality certificate.

  • Fairtrade / Direct Trade : We are a part of coffee enthusiastic community who's members are traveling around the world in order to find small, sustainable, privately owned farms with best quality Coffee.

Funding

All the funds provided are going toward various equipment to make us operational: like Coffee machine ,grinders counter tops and to secure a location. All the remaining funds will go toward staff training and filling up the pantry.

How can you help

If you like Old Friends Coffee Bar, but aren’t quite ready to pledge, you can help us make Old Friends a success by sharing our posts on social media, giving us your feedback and telling your friends and family about us and our Indiegogo campaign.

story:
About Us

Based in metro Detroit, The Vegan Marshmallow Co. creates natural, handmade marshmallows in an exciting collection of imaginative flavors. Our marshmallows contain only fresh, natural ingredients and are soy, corn, and carrageenan free. Any color or texture you experience also comes from natural ingredients.

We have been creating amazing confections for quite a few years. When several of our family members began transitioning to a vegetarian, then vegan diet, we found ourselves having to make some significant modifications to our recipes for marshmallows, truffles, cakes and cookies to accomodate their new lifestyles. Realizing that there are so few vegan marshmallow options we set out to create the best vegan marshmallows in the same amazing flavors which are available to non vegans. After SOOO many tries, we have FINALLY come up with a formula that, not only tastes great, but is the closest texture to a traditional marshmallow while still being gelatin, corn, soy and carrageenan free. 

We are off to a pretty good start with our designs, formula, and website done. We have even secured a small workspace where we can build a kitchen with dedicated equipment for vegan production. With YOUR support, we can purchase equipment, ingredients, and packaging and start our first major production run so we can get our sweets to fluff lovers across the US.

What We Need & What You Get

Our $14,135 goal will be used as follows (graphic):

Our equipment list includes, mixers, cutters, baking trays, storage, worktables and a countertop oven.

We have some scrumptious rewards for you when you back our project! Yummy marshmallows in our fabulous flavors, spring s'mores, marshmallow messages VeganMarshCo swag and even an intro pack to our vegan desserts!

Risks & Challenges

We are aware that all startups have some level of risk involved. New business owners face challenges from customer acquisition to cash flow and more. Having been a successful confectioner and business owner we are fully prepared to  use our experience to quickly fix any issues asap. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't unable to back us at this time, we totally get it! It would mean a ton to us, though, if you could share our project like crazy with your community of friends, coworkers and family.

story:
Our Pitch

          -Jake Jarvinen: Brewmaster and Supplier/Charity Liaison

         -Ken Canning: Logistic Coordination and Brewing Assistant

Both owners are well entrenched in the hospitality industry. With plenty of experience working in bars, pubs, as well as fine dining establishments. These establishments include but are not limited to the Italian Cultural center and the Warehouse group, owners of "The Warehouse," "The Factory," etc..

 

  • Meads and wines have been enjoyed throughout the ages by kings and peasants alike. These drinks have brought people together throughout time immemorial, with the technology available to us in the present; we want to bring some of the most forgotten ancient libations back into circulation crafted to a quality that our ancestors could only dream of.

 

  • -This concept taps a potentially huge unexplored and undeveloped market. 

    -Takes advantage of British Columbia’s well established fruit and honey industries.

    -Promotes not only the fruit and honey markets of British Columbia, but the wine industry as well

What We Need & What You Get

Here's me breaking things down so you know what we will be doing with any funds you choose to impart to us.

We are seeking this primary 25,000$ to cover the cost of:

  • BCLCRB License: 1,100$
  • Accounting & Legal Fees 3,000$
  • Taxes and Applicable fees: 5,000$
  • Contract Brewing First Batch: 15,900$

     
  • We will be offering specialized leatherworks crafted by our friends at red wolf accessories as well as t-shirts and hoodies 
  • Provided we aren't able to get the bulk of our funding we will be using it to cover the costs of the things we have mentioned above at least in part. 

Our intended effect and goals

                                             -Short Term Goals (2 – 5 years)

  • -Produce 3400 liters of wine/mead in year 1 (Year starting after licensing)
  • -Produce 2 wines/meads in year 1 (Year starting after licensing)
  • -Establish an online marketing program and wine club
  • -Produce 6800 liters of wine/mead in year 2 
  • -Acquire the "Made in BC" label for using mainly BC products.
  • -Produce 7 wines and meads in year 2
  • -Establish a sufficient customer base to sell everything produced 
  • -Move to a brick and mortar facility with a Slavic themed tasting room by year 2 or 3
  • -Produce 10,200 liters of wine/mead in year 3

 

         Listed below are the values we wish to instill within the company which will result in benefits ranging from interpersonal to a planetary scale

  • Offering aid back to the community to ensure a viable future for us and others.
  • Offering a helping hand to bees during these turbulent times.
  • Sustainability in all aspects of our business: environmental, economic and spiritual, for both our company and community.  
  • Offering education to people who want to know more about ancient craft recipes.
  • Quality ingredients (raw, local and organic where possible).
  • Quality production (high cleanliness and sanitation standards).
  • Respectful behaviour.
  • Mindfulness and diligence.

Risks & Challenges

Most of the challenges that arise in our endeavor are related around the fact that meads and country wines are not readily available or provided by most retailers. This has resulted in a substantial lack of information around what they are and what they taste like.

  • Through the process of brewing and tasting our own beverages we've been able to see what works and what doesn't. This has also led us to giving away our tester batches to everyone we legally can, helping us align our product with a more generalized palate. The knowledge of what these drinks are has been spreading to more people through our efforts and this has allowed us to slowly garner a base market for once we are in business.
  • Mead in itself has been seen as a uncategorized drink, it is neither a beer or wine. (However depending on who you ask you may receive a different response.) This results in a varied perspective towards the drink. Some may avoid it because it is not a "beer," others may also avoid it because it is not by technical definition a "wine." However due to its double sided nature there are those who will jump at the chance to sample a "honey wine" or those who enjoy craft brewed drinks may desire to try a lighter, less hoppy drink sweetened with fruit juice, honey, or spices.
  • Thanks to our connections within the hospitality, rural/country and fantasy/science-fiction community we have seen great interest in the products we plan to offer. These communities are mostly locally based. We will also be reaching out to online markets as well to boost our sales and reach a broader base of clientele in different regions and sectors who want to try something new.

Brewing methods are a secondary challenge which we have a keen eye towards optimizing.

  • Country wines are wines made using fruits outside of the grape family, these include but are not limited to: Cherries, Apples, Pumpkins, Blackberries, and Raspberries. The reason we plan to use these types of fruits has a multifaceted response. These fruits can be stored for long periods of time without degradation provided they are refrigerated or frozen (unlike grapes). We will not require a large property to produce our product for the same reason mentioned above. (Grapes must be used right away or a winery will risk going brown and souring the quality.)
  • These other fruit juices are not sought widely for potential alcohol fermentation leading them to be potentially cheaper than their grape related counterparts.
  • This can be said for honey as well which can withstand aeons without refrigeration and still be consumable and tasty. This allows us to purchase in bulk and to store this product for an indefinite period of time rendering it cheaper as a source of fermentable material.

 

  • Mead can be made using traditional brewing techniques associated with either wine making or beer making processes. Some of these brewing processes are expensive or unnecessary for the production of mead.

       -Beer requires lots of heat and specialized equipment. (For example you need to crack     your grains prior to boiling the wort to release sugars.)

      -Traditional wines require some specialized equipment as such as fruit presses to process              grapes as quickly as possible to avoid degradation of the fruit.

  • For the purposes of our product we are applying for a commercial winery license which is not allowed to have grain on premises however we will be allowed to have various fruit juices and spices which we will be adding to our meads and wines to give them unique flavours this also means we will be prescribing to the winery method of brewing mead to go along with our country wine additions. As mentioned above, our fruits can be stored for long periods of time and do not require on the site processing, (cutting down on our operating costs.) We will be acquiring our fruit juices from Pacific Coast Fruit Products and storing them within a fridge and freezer to be used when required. Our honey will be purchased in bulk barrels of 285lbs at a charge of 5.65$ a kilogram from Beexcellent Honey.
  • During our initial proceedings we will be contract brewing with an already established company. This allows us to get the first batch out the door faster, as there will be no need to obtain equipment or facilities of our own as well as utilizing the expertise our contract brewing partner will have in navigating this industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

We have a Facebook page as well as an Instagram and a website. If you are unable to donate you can still spread the word to your friends, family and coworkers who might show an interest, and have the means to help. That doesn't mean we want to exclude you if you can't help. Feel free to join us online and watch our progress and give us input on what you think we can do to optimize our facility and to help reach people like you who have a fascination with these time tested, delicious, and undermarketed beverages. Indiegogo also has tools you can use to help share this idea with people in your circle of influence as well. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this, I enjoyed making this. If you're interested in the products we will be releasing please read on!
